result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolas J Krimmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
of Proceedings held August 2, 2016
Filed in 16-CF-2

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF46, 16CF11, 16CM33, 16CF2, 16TR17, 16TR20, 16TR69, 16TR19, 16TR22, 16TR21 & 16TR18  @ 3:53 pm.  Atty Bennett is not representing def.  State gives plea agreement, 16CF2, 16CF11, 16CM33, 16CF46  Plea questionnaire  has attachment sheet from Atty Bennett, Def. has reviewed attachment sheet. 16CF2 Plea to ct 1, 60 days jail, consecutive to 16CF11 & 16CF46, 3 days credit, ct 2 DRI, 16CF11, Plea to ct 1, 6 months jail, consecutive 16CF46, ct 2 plea, costs only, time served, 80 days jail, completed, 60 days credit time served, ct 3 DRI, 16CF33 Victim notification complied with, DRI, 16CF46, plea to ct 1, 8 years prison, 3 years initial confinement,  5 years extended supervision, no credit, ct 2 DRI, ct 3 DRI, ct 4 plea, time served sentence, 137 days credit, 6 months jail, ct 5 & ct 6 DRI.  Atty Bennett and def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF2 Ct 1 Fleeing, no contest plea, 16CF11 Ct 1 Fleeing, no contest, ct 2 Bailjumping, no contest  16CF46 Ct 1 no contest plea, ct 4 no contest plea, DRI following cases, 16CF2 ct 2, 16CF11 ct 3, 16CF46 ct's 2 3 5 & 6, 16CM33. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T rights. Def. understand elements. Def. admits 3 prior convictions.  ct 4 repeater is a mute point in 16CF46. Court Atty Bennett is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds def. Guilty to  16CF2 ct 1, Fleeing, 16CF11 Fleeing in ct 1, Bailjumping in ct 2, 16CF46 Poss w intent Amphetamine, PTAC,  2nd offense in ct 1 and Resisting, repeater.  State gives sentencing recommendation. State would like bonds be applied to costs. Atty Bennett gives sentencing recommendation. 
S.P. makes statement.  Def. makes statement.  State replys to sentence with brother. Court accepts plea agreement and orders on 
16CF46 ct 1 8 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision, no credit, court costs, 250 DNA Surcharge, Strike repeater enhancer, 939.62(1)(b), DNA Sample.
ct 4 6 months jail, 137 days credit, deemed served, costs, 200 DNA surcharge
16CF11 ct 1 6 months jail, consecutive to 16CF46, no credit, costs, $250 DNA Surcharge
ct 2 80 days jail, 60 days credit, Deemed completed,  costs, $250 DNA Surcharge
16CF2 ct 1 60 days jail, consecutive to all other sentences from today, 3 days credit, costs, 250 DNA Surcharge
Bonds to be applied all court costs, Def. advised of firearms and voting rights. 
Def. is eligible for Challenge & Substance Program
Def. advised of postconviction rights. 
Court advised def. of options. Def. would agree to civil judgment 15TR186, 15TR307, 15TR555 & 15TR556, Court orders fine and costs converted to civil judgment.  
16TR17, 16TR20, 16TR69, 16TR19, 16TR22, 16TR21 & 16TR18 - Dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court, in custody with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF46, 16CF11, 16CM33,16CF2, 16TR20, 16TR22, 16TR19, 16TR17 16TR21, 16TR69, 16TR18  @ 9:48 am.   Atty Bennett is representing def on all criminal case.  Atty Bennett heard on State handle cases earlier.  State clarifies only business level.  State has not represented defendant. Parties don't object to have GBA to continue with case today. Court will proceed.  Waiver of preliminary examination on 16CF46, 16CF2 & 16CF11 has already waives p.h. on both cases.   16CF45 - Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed.  Atty Bennett has copy of information, waives reading, reserve all rights & enters Not Guilty plea to 6 ct's.  Court enters Not Guilty plea to 6 ct's.  Atty Bennett heard on bond argument.  State gives bond argument. State moves in 16CF2, 16CM33  to revoke bond.  Atty Bennett has not received forfeiture on bond. Court will in 16CF2 & 16CF11 & 16CM33 will reserve ruling to forfeit bond.  16CF46 Court gives ruling on bond.  M.P & D.P. in courtroom.  Parties in courtroom will not post any monies. No offer in courtroom.  Court finds mute point. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on March 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court, in custody& via-video.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF2, 16CF11 & 16CM33 @ 9:25 am. Court tried to contact Atty Morgan but went to voicemail. Court explains understanding on all 3 files, request has been made to have defendant attend rehab, Def. did get accepted, & court agreed to lower bond to 500 cash and def. to go to rehab, however family couldn't post, then this Monday Court directed Clerk to complete new bond for $500.00 cash w/condition, & Clerk took over to jail. Later Monday night somebody posted cash. On Tuesday court found out that def. was back in custody,  Judge went to jail to see bond, Jail didn't have def sign bond however released him. State will move to revoke bonds and will file motion. The $500.00 cash bond with rehab, Def. will not sign. Court directs Clerk to write refuse on bond. (Advised Judge bail bond already filed, so can't write refused on bond.)
Bail Bond $500.00 cash signed by Judge 3-14-16, returned unsigned - see 16CF2

Attorney Andrew M. Morgan in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF2, 16CM33 and 16CF11  Def has been accepted to Marathon County Health Care Center.  Court will permit $500.00 cash bond while def is in treatment.  Statement by def's mother in regards to cash bond.  Court remains firm, def to post $500.00 for bond while in treatment.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court, in custody & via-video with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 16CM33 & 16CF2 @ 4:08 pm. 16CM33 Atty Morgan has copy of complaint, waives reading, enters Not Guilty plea.  Def. advised of charge & penalties.  Court receives Not Guilty plea.  Bond remains.  16CF2 $500.00 Bond, State moves to forfeit. Atty Morgan gives argument. Court will remain bond/forfeiture pending until sentence.  Atty Morgan heard on inpatient treatment. Court will remain pending on bond forfeiture.  Court heard on handling treatment will wait until date set.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges with possible penalties.  Copy of complaint will be provided to def.  Statement by Mr Krimmer.  State requesting signature bond.  Bond set by Court  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
